cd5e31c1d068.description: Everything you wanted to know about money but were too polite to ask.
cd5e31c1d068.name: The Billfold
cd5e31c1d068.shortDescription: Everything you wanted to know about money but were too…

paragraphs.text: Maybe I could take Lyft to my gym. A one-way Lyft trip from my job would be around $7 plus tip. Since I usually give a $5 tip, a Lyft trip would cost me $12. But then, I would still have to take two buses and a train to get home. Taking Lyft both ways would reduce the money in my wallet by at least $26. Going to the gym three times a week would cost $78, more than the utility payment at my new apartment.
paragraphs.name: aa16

53052d4dcef3.title: Have you ever thought about just getting out for a run?

paragraphs.text: Have you ever thought about just getting out for a run? Maybe working out in other ways at home? If it is just weight control, getting into a 5 day running regimen and proper diet, will go a long way. Mix in some bodyweight exercises and you will get all you need to maintain your figure and feel better. Also, you might pick up your favorite machine…
paragraphs.name: dc06

22d0532f1e2.title: I do understand liking the gym you have and not wanting to start over elsewhere, but it really…

paragraphs.text: I do understand liking the gym you have and not wanting to start over elsewhere, but it really sounds like that might be your only practical option. This is such a crazy amount of complication! Or maybe you’d be better off just walking… you could surely cover six miles in an hour or two, which seems to be as long as it’s gonna take anyway, and…
paragraphs.name: 1fe6

3ce8963d8f4a.title: Is it possible to bike to your gym?

paragraphs.text: Is it possible to bike to your gym? (thereby nearly obviating the need to workout at the gym?) I bike 6 miles to work. Yes, yes, you need to buy a bike, but you’ve already considered buying a car and the most expensive bike and accessories won’t cost more than 3 months of car ownership.
paragraphs.name: 5e68

paragraphs.text: Also, is it possible just to buy whatever machine you use and put it in your apartment?
paragraphs.name: dc5a

virtuals.subtitle: Also, is it possible just to buy whatever machine you use and put it in your apartment?

content.subtitle: Also, is it possible just to buy whatever machine you use and put it in your apartment?

paragraphs.text: Good lord! A 70% tip?!
Most drivers don’t expect tips so I usually just tip them a dollar (still 14% on $7) which will still boost their profit margin considerably.
paragraphs.name: 022e

virtuals.subtitle: Most drivers don’t expect tips so I usually just tip them a dollar (still 14% on $7) which will still boost their profit margin…

content.subtitle: Most drivers don’t expect tips so I usually just tip them a dollar (still 14% on $7) which will still boost their profit margin…

paragraphs.text: Good luck, Bernice! There are also a lot of good bodyweight exercises you could do at home, and save machine- or weights-based movements for the Sundays when you can make it in?
paragraphs.name: dc0e

f361d3fd6ae8.title: Aggh, I feel this dilemma — it’s not one I share, but I totally get the line of thinking.

paragraphs.text: Aggh, I feel this dilemma — it’s not one I share, but I totally get the line of thinking. It really makes you feel the “time is money” adage when you don’t have the money and are coerced into giving up the time. It’s technically possible to keep going to the gym cheaply, but man, it’s so much time.
paragraphs.name: a347

paragraphs.text: Nike Training Club!
paragraphs.name: 70e2

ee79c2490ff6.title: I figured out that a convenient gym is much more cost effective to me because I actually go.

paragraphs.text: I figured out that a convenient gym is much more cost effective to me because I actually go. Currently, I pay for a specialized boxing gym (which is expensive, but less than 5 mins from my house) and use a free work gym. There are plenty of less expensive gym options available than my expensive boxing gym, but I know I won’t go to them.
paragraphs.name: 6ac1

da2606b7830f.title: You’re only six miles? Run or bike to the gym then run or bike home. Your jeans will fit soon.

paragraphs.text: You’re only six miles? Run or bike to the gym then run or bike home. Your jeans will fit soon.
paragraphs.name: a11a

paragraphs.text: I agree with Buckwheat! I walk or ride my bike everywhere (work, grocery store, traveling, etc.) and it means that I don’t have to go to the gym. For me, the costs saving go far beyond avoiding a gym membership.
paragraphs.name: b44b

dc5d71d5cb52.title: What breaks my heart so much is that you felt like you failed only going twice.

paragraphs.text: What breaks my heart so much is that you felt like you failed only going twice. Twice a week will keep you progressing.
You need to find somewhere closer — cancel or sell your current membership to someone else to fund an at home workout setup.

virtuals.subtitle: You need to find somewhere closer — cancel or sell your current membership to someone else to fund an at home workout setup.

content.subtitle: You need to find somewhere closer — cancel or sell your current membership to someone else to fund an at home workout setup.

fd755128f3b.title: A lot of these suggestions (bike, walk, run) for either transportation or exercise would depend on…

paragraphs.text: A lot of these suggestions (bike, walk, run) for either transportation or exercise would depend on living somewhere that has a climate where it is reasonable to do. If you live somewhere with 8 months of winter those things are not awesome. Technically doable sure, but for me the key to actually getting exercise was finding something that I didn’t…
paragraphs.name: df8e

58147d4901e8.title: I finally had to admit to myself that I am not the kind of person that gets to the gym.

paragraphs.text: I finally had to admit to myself that I am not the kind of person that gets to the gym. Bit the bullet and invested in an elliptical and some weights and kettlebells (I think everything was $650 or so, all new? this was five years ago, so I’m already at around a $150/year price. This was after trying to find something decent on craiglist for less for…
paragraphs.name: a5b8

paragraphs.text: Similar dilemma. I had my “family” gym (everyone in my family is on the plan and my parents paid for it!) which is close to my home and the gym I became a gym- goer in/love. I have the gym that’s included in my grad school tuition which is nice but neither close to home nor school so while its “free”, I was rarely able to go consistently because it…
paragraphs.name: 5f4e
